intro: Phagnalon ballii subsp. embergeri, commonly known as the Emberger's phagnalon, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb characterized by its basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves. The plant produces small, pink or white flowers arranged in a spike during the summer months. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its botanical features make it well adapted to the harsh conditions of its native environment.
